official-title.#text:
To revise the composition of the Board of Regents of the
		  Smithsonian Institution so that all members are individuals appointed by the
		  President from a list of nominees submitted by the leadership of the Congress,
		  and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

shall be appointed for a term
				of 6 years, and may be reappointed for additional terms.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Regent of the Smithsonian Institution

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
who
				are appointed after the date of the enactment of the

text.#text:
4 shall be
				appointed for a term of 2 years (as designated in the joint resolution under
				which they are appointed) and may be reappointed for additional terms of 6
				years; and

4 shall be appointed for a term of 4 years
				(as designated in the joint resolution under which they are appointed) and may
				be reappointed for additional terms of 6 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
appointed to fill a vacancy
				occurring before the expiration of the term for which the Regent’s predecessor
				was appointed shall be appointed only for the remainder of that term. A
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Regent of the Smithsonian Institution

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may serve after the expiration of that Regent’s term until a successor has
				taken
				office.
